column4: I there, just did apt-get dist-upgrade from breezy to dapper... I have no sound anymore... any idea ?

Hello, since my upgrade from Breezy to Dapper I have no more sound. Perhaps is it because of the new kernel ? Do I need to add some alsa modules ? If I do lsmod | grep -i alsa I get nothing... any idea ?
thank you. lsmod | grep -i snd does give me a list of modules
and see if anything is inadvertently muted
now this is where it becomes a black art: do you have more than one sound card, and can you confirm which soundcard it is attempting to blay through
I have only one soundcard, an Intel i810/ac97 on the motherboard
do you have a software modem that could be mistook for a soundcard?
no modem at all, only a NIC
what happens when you try to play a sound? do you get an error? do any apps work?
everything works, but I hear no sound
... have you plugged in speakers/earphones and switched on as appropriate? (I have to ask)
It was the PCM which was at zero
what was it? share the wealth for whoever searches these archives!
